Title.evidence: Background: This study aimed to characterize the inflammatory and coagulopathic response after endovascular thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm (TAAA) repair and evaluate its effect on post-operative renal function.

Trial_Design.evidence: Methods: A single-center, prospective cohort study was conducted from July 2005 to June 2008.

Participants.evidence: Forty-two patients undergoing elective endovascular TAAA repair with custom-designed multi-branched stent-grafts were enrolled.

Intervention.evidence: Forty-two patients undergoing elective endovascular TAAA repair with custom-designed multi-branched stent-grafts were enrolled.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to characterize the inflammatory and coagulopathic response after endovascular thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm (TAAA) repair and evaluate its effect on post-operative renal function.

Method_Outcome.evidence: White blood cell count (WBC), platelet count, prothrombin time (PT), and creatinine were measured in all patients.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Forty-two patients undergoing elective endovascular TAAA repair with custom-designed multi-branched stent-grafts were enrolled. Four patients were excluded, leaving 38 for analysis.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Four patients were excluded, leaving 38 for analysis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The 30-day mortality rate was 5% (2/38). All patients had increased WBC (139 ± 80%, P<0.0001), decreased platelet count (56 ± 15%, P<0.0001), and increased PT (median: 17%, IQR 12 - 22%, P<0.0001) post-procedure.
